description.narrative: Magic Box is the leading producer in Kyrgyz Republic of small cardboard packages and one of the major label producers (based on offset printing) with exports to Kazakhstan and Tajikistan. Magic Box produces a variety of small size packaging and printing products for the tea, beverage, confectionary, food, detergent, and tobacco industries with an annual turnover of $3.3 million in 2009. In 2007, IFC helped the company in its first capacity expansion in cardboard packages through a $1.5 million loan. Magic Box is currently undertaking a $5.3 million investment project to (i) diversify its production base by production of flexible packaging that will serve a wider range of clients in Kyrgyzstan and Kazakhstan; and (ii) improve operational efficiency and expand current offset production.

The investment will help increase Magic Box's product range and variety, thereby improving its competitiveness and export capacity into neighboring markets in the region, notably the larger Kazakstan market. The project will also promote import substitution in Kyrgyz Republic.

name.narrative: The project is located in the Bishkek Free Economic Zone, in Ak-Chyi village, about half an hour away from Bishkek. The Zone was created by the Government with suitable road, power, water and security infrastructure, and houses several light industrial companies. The investment will be located within the current facilities already owned by the company, with some additional space to be built.
